item.title: Building and Install Tmux from Source on CentOS 7
item.description: Tmux is a great terminal multiplexer. The Tmux installed by yum is too old1 on my CentOS servers. So I decided to install the latest version of Tmux that supports true colors. Since I do not have root priviledge on the system, I have to build Tmux from source and install it under my HOME directory. If that is also what you want to do, keep reading.

item.title: Vim-like Settings for Tmux
item.description: I am a Neovim (or Nvim in abbreviation) user. In Nvim, we use Ctrl-W as prefix for window-related operations. However, the default prefix is Ctrl-B in Tmux. As a result, I often mistakenly press Ctrl-W when trying to change panes inside Tmux, which is annoying. Why not change tmux prefix to be more vim-like?
